meanings.definition: High-sounding but with little meaning; inflated.
meanings.sent1: The bombastic speech was so exaggerated that no one believed it.
meanings.sent2: Her bombastic style of writing made the essay difficult to understand.
meanings.sent3: The bombastic politician's promises were as empty as a balloon without air.
meanings.sent4: His bombastic claims were like a bubble ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The bombastic music blared through the speakers, overwhelming the audience.

meanings.definition: Pompous or overblown in language; full of high-sounding words.
meanings.sent1: The bombastic movie trailer made the film seem more exciting than it was.
meanings.sent2: She always used bombastic language to impress others, but it often backfired.
meanings.sent3: The bombastic chef described his soup as a symphony of flavors.
meanings.sent4: His bombastic speech was like a fireworks show of grandiose words.
meanings.sent5: The bombastic advertisement promised a magical solution to all problems.
